hanzi-su-wiki:
賓

Значения

Гость

Мнемоника

Упрощение. Гость приходит в дом 宀 с денежными 貝 подарками, оставляя себе лишь малую 少 толику средств.

Варианты

賓, 宾, 賔

bīn
visitor; guest; object (in grammar)
посетитель; гость; объект (в грамматике)

賓賓RS
宾宾		賓𡧍𡧎𡪛𡫅𤍘 𥦎𥧨𧶉𧶎guest, visitor, obey, submit

heisig_chinese_memo: This house is reserved to the few V.I.P. visitors who have enough money only.&nbsp
heisig_constituent: V.I.P., house, one, ceiling, few, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight
heisig_story: The V.I.P. indicated here is an important guest making a visit. The elements are: house . . . ceiling . . . few . . . shells.
koohiiStory1: This house is reserved to V.I.P. only. If you are not one of the few with enough money to call you that way, keep out!
koohiiStory2: The V.I.P. visits your house, but your ceiling is too low for his inflated head, which he bumps and hurts. You have to give him your few shells as compensation.
WaniKani_Radicals: 宀, 一, 少, 貝
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Between the roof and the ground there are few shellfish. This is because we invited some VIP guests into our home and they ate all our shellfish.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: The VIPs came into our home (the place between our roof and the ground) where they consumed all our shellfish. Only the best for guests, I guess.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: These VIP guests are part of a Hindu (ひん) envoy.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: We are treating these VIP guests extra special because they represent the whole Hindu religion. They get shellfish because of course we weren't going to serve them beef!
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), ノ, ハ, 宀 (значок У), 小 (маленький), 目 (глаз), 貝 (раковина)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the shellfish (貝) is the one (一) among few (少) under the roof (宀) to be a VIP
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: During a war the troops are a common form of visitor to a house.
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle starts from "宀" from " person ", or adds from " stop ". " Zhi " is like a visitor, and " Bing " is like a host welcoming guests in under the house (Ye Yusen). The original meaning is guest. " Ren " may be in the form of " 10,000 " (the original text of "丏"), and "丏" as the sound symbol is the result of tonalization . The sounds of "丏" and " bin " are similar. The oracle bone inscriptions are used for the names of sacrifices and people.

Bronze inscriptions from "宀" from " ten thousand " to " bei ", " bei " is a gift from the guests. In ancient times, guests must have something to give. The gift is called a guest, so the word is from Bei (Wang Guowei) . Therefore, " guest " also means gift.

Jinwen means guests, Wang Sunzhong: "I am a guest father and brother with pleasure", Fengzhong: "I am a good guest", with a child hook: "To feast the guests." Express gift, classics as " best man ", two worship 𠨘 its wine container: "Binbei five friends," Shou Gui: "Binma two." Also used as a name.

The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period are pronounced " Bin ", "Shangbo Chu Zhushu II. "Rong Chengshi": "Hebin" means "hebin".

"Said Wen": "The guest is respected. From the shell sound. 𧶉, ancient prose." Duan Yucai's note: "The guest is the person respected, because it respects the person and is also the guest.... The sheller, respects it. Things are also." "Book of Rites. King System": "Friends and Guests". "Jade Chapter": "Guest, guest."
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle starts from "宀" from " person ", or adds from " stop ". " Zhi " is like a visitor, and " Bing " is like a host welcoming guests in under the house (Ye Yusen). The original meaning is guest.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從「宀」從「人」，或加從「止」。「止」象來客，「賓」象主人在屋下迎接客人進來(葉玉森)。本義是賓客。「人」或作「万」形(「丏」之初文)，「丏」作為聲符，是聲化的結果，「丏」、「賓」音近。甲骨文用作祭名及人名。

　　金文從「宀」從「万」從「貝」，「貝」是賓客的饋贈，古者賓客至必有物贈之，其贈之事謂之賓，故其字從貝(王國維)。故「賓」又有贈送之意。

　　金文表示賓客，王孫鐘：「用樂我嘉賓父兄」，虘鐘：「用濼好賓」，配兒鈎鑃：「以宴賓客」。表示贈送，典籍作「儐」，二祀𠨘其卣：「賓貝五朋」，守簋：「賓馬兩」。又用作人名。

　　戰國竹簡讀作「濱」，《上博楚竹書二．容成氏》：「河賓」即「河濱」。

　　《說文》：「賓，所敬也。从貝𡧍聲。𧶉，古文。」段玉裁注：「賓謂所敬之人，因之敬其人亦曰賓。……貝者，敬之之物也。」《禮記．王制》：「朋友賓客」。《玉篇》：「賓，客也。」
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文從「宀」從「人」，或加從「止」。「止」象來客，「賓」象主人在屋下迎接客人進來(葉玉森)。本義是賓客。

甲骨文從「 宀 」從「 人 」，或加從「 止 」。「 止 」象來客，「 賓 」象主人在屋下迎接客人進來(葉玉森)。本義是賓客。「 人 」或作「 万 」形(「 丏 」之初文)，「 丏 」作為聲符，是聲化的結果，「 丏 」、「 賓 」音近。甲骨文用作祭名及人名。 金文從「 宀 」從「 万 」從「 貝 」，「 貝 」是賓客的饋贈，古者賓客至必有物贈之，其贈之事謂之賓，故其字從貝(王國維)。故「 賓 」又有贈送之意。 金文表示賓客，王孫鐘：「用樂我嘉賓父兄」，虘鐘：「用濼好賓」，配兒鈎鑃：「以宴賓客」。表示贈送，典籍作「 儐 」，二祀𠨘其卣：「賓貝五朋」，守簋：「賓馬兩」。又用作人名。 戰國竹簡讀作「 濱 」，《上博楚竹書二．容成氏》：「河賓」即「河濱」。 《說文》：「賓，所敬也。从貝𡧍聲。𧶉，古文。」段玉裁注：「賓謂所敬之人，因之敬其人亦曰賓。……貝者，敬之之物也。」《禮記．王制》：「朋友賓客」。《玉篇》：「賓，客也。」
Oracle starts from " 宀" from " person", or adds from " stop". " Zhi" is like a visitor, and " Bing" is like a host welcoming guests in under the house (Ye Yusen). The original meaning is guest. " Ren" may be in the form of " 10,000" (the original text of " 丏"), and " 丏" as the sound symbol is the result of tonalization. The sounds of " 丏" and " bin" are similar. The oracle bone inscriptions are used for the names of sacrifices and people. Bronze inscriptions from " 宀" from " ten thousand" to " bei", " bei" is a gift from the guests. In ancient times, guests must have something to give. The gift is called a guest, so the word is from Bei (Wang Guowei) . Therefore, " guest" also means gift. Jinwen means guests, Wang Sunzhong: "I am a guest father and brother with pleasure", Fengzhong: "I am a good guest", with a child hook: "To feast the guests." Express gift, classics as " best man", two worship 𠨘 its wine container: "Binbei five friends," Shou Gui: "Binma two." Also used as a name. The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period are pronounced " Bin", "Shangbo Chu Zhushu II. "Rong Chengshi": "Hebin" means "hebin". "Said Wen": "The guest is respected. From the shell sound. 𧶉, ancient prose." Duan Yucai's note: "The guest is the person respected, because it respects the person and is also the guest.... The sheller, respects it. Things are also." "Book of Rites. King System": "Friends and Guests". "Jade Chapter": "Guest, guest."

賓字的基本解释

賓
bīn
见“宾”。

賓字的汉语字典释义

[①]［bīn］
［《廣韻》必鄰切，平真，幫。］
“宾1”的繁体字。亦作“賔1”。
(1)宾客。
(2)尊敬。
(3)以客礼相待。
(4)作客；客居。
(5)服从；归顺。
(6)陈列。
(7)指事物之名。常与“實”对举。
(8)戏曲用语。即对话。
(9)上古官名。
(10)通“儐”。引导；迎宾。
(11)通“濱”。水边。
(12)通“濱”。紧接；临近。
(13)用同“鑌”。参见“賓鐵”。
(14)姓。春秋有宾起、宾孟。见《左传·昭公二十二年》。
[②]［bìn］
［《集韻》必仞切，去稕，幫。］
通“擯1”。
摈弃；排除；拒却。

賓字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【貝字部】　賓； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页1208第37
〔古文〕????【唐韻】必鄰切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?民切，?音濱。【說文】所敬也。【玉篇】客也。【易·觀卦】利用賓于王。【書·舜典】賓于四門。又【洪範】八政，七曰賓。【傳】禮賓客無不敬。【儀禮·士冠禮】主人戒賓。【註】賓，主人之僚友。　又【爾雅·釋詁】賓，服也。【疏】賓者，懷德而服。【新序】先王所以拱揖指揮，而四海賓者，誠德之至已形于外，故《詩》曰：王猷允塞，徐方旣來。　又【書·堯典】寅賓出日。【傳】賓，導也。【釋文】從也。　又律名。【禮·月令】律中蕤賓。【註】仲夏氣至，則蕤賓之律應。【白虎通】蕤者，下也。賓者，敬也，言陽氣上極，隂氣始賓敬之也。　又罽賓，西域國名。【前漢·西域傳】罽賓國王治循鮮城。　又姓。【玉海】賓氏，周有賓滑、賓起，齊有賓胥無、賓媚人。　又官名。【唐書·百官志】司賓、典賓、掌賓各二人。　又龍賓。【陶家瓶餘事】明皇御案墨，一日見小道士如蠅，呼萬歲。曰：臣，墨之精，黑松使者也。凡世有文者，墨上有龍賓十二。上神之，乃以分賜掌文

Bin
Basic explanation of words
Bin
bīn
See "Bin".
Bin
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［bīn］
["Guangyun" must be neighbors, plain, help. ]
Traditional characters for "宾1". Also known as "Bladder 1".
(1) Guests.
(2) Respect.
(3) Treat each other with courtesy.
(4) Being a guest; living as a guest.
(5) Obey; submit.
(6) Display.
(7) Refers to the name of things. Often opposed to "real".
(8) Opera terms. That is dialogue.
(9) Ancient official names.
(10) Through "brother". Guide; welcome guests.
(11) Link "Bin". Waterside.
(12) Link "Bin". Immediately after; approaching.
(13) Use the same "镔". See "Bin Tie".
(14) Last name. There are Binqi and Binmeng in Spring and Autumn. See "Twenty-two Years of Zuo Zhuan · Zhaogong".
[②]［bìn］
["Jiyun" must be cut, go to the 稕, help. ]
Same as "摈1".
Abandon; exclude; reject.
Bin
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Unitary Collection] [Beijing Department] 　 Bin; Kangxi Strokes: 14; Page Number: Page 1208 Page 37
[Ancient text]???? [Tang Yun] must be adjacent to [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Zheng Yun] People cut, sound shore. [Said the text] also respected. [Jade articles] Guest also. 【Yi·Guan Gua】Using Bin Yu Wang. 【Book·Shun Code】Bin in the four gates. Also 【Hong Fan】Eight politics, Qiyue guest. [Biography] The courtesy guests are all disrespectful. 【Rituals·Shiguan Ceremony】The host bans guests. [Note] Bin, the host’s staff and friends.　[Erya·Shi Xie] Bin, take it. 【Sparse】The guest, take care of virtue. [New Preface] The first king is so commanding, and the guests from all over the world have the best of sincerity and virtue. Therefore, the "Poem" says: Wang You Yunsai, Xu Fangming comes.　[Book·Yao Dian] Yinbin goes out. [Biography] Bin, guide also. [Explanation] Cong Ye.　Also known as the law. 【Rite·Monthly Order】Liubing in the law. [Note] When the midsummer weather is up, the law of protactinium will respond. 【Baihutong】The protactinium protactinium is also down. The guest, respecting, speaks yang to the extreme, and yin begins to respect the guest.　You Fengbin, the name of the Western Regions. [Pre-Han · Western Regions Biography] King Fengbin ruled Xunxian City.　Another last name. [Jade Sea] Bin, Zhou Youbin is skating, Bin Qi, Qi has Bin Xu Wu, Bin Meiren.　Also official name. [Tang Shu·Hundred Officials] Two people each: Si Bin, Dian Bin and Zhang Bin.　Longbin again. [Remains in the Tao Jia Ping] Ming Huang's imperial case, I saw the little Taoist flies like a fly one day, and long live. Said: Chen, the spirit of Mo, and the messenger of the black pine. There are Twelve Dragon Bins in the ink of those who have written literature. God’s hand is written by dispensation

Meaning Mnemonic
Between the roof and the ground there are few shellfish. This is because we invited some VIP guests into our home and they ate all our shellfish.
The VIPs came into our home (the place between our roof and the ground) where they consumed all our shellfish. Only the best for guests, I guess.
Reading Mnemonic
These VIP guests are part of a Hindu (ひん) envoy.
We are treating these VIP guests extra special because they represent the whole Hindu religion. They get shellfish because of course we weren't going to serve them beef!
